result.execSummary:
The defendant Jack Lee Christy was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Violate/Harassment Restraining Order, an unclassified misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 813.125(7).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes:
Serve 10 days in the Pepin County Jail and stayed on the following conditions:
1.  Continue making County Appointed Attorney Fee payments to Pepin County Clerk of Court.
2.  No other violations of the Harassment Restraining Order.

Court waives costs/surcharges.  
AMENDED 05-18-2015:  County Appointed Attorney Fees ordered in the amount of $1049.50 with defendant reimbursing Pepin County as previously ordered of $75.00 per month.

records.addlTxt: Order for Compensation of Court Appointed Atty.  Ordered that $1049.50 be allowed to said atty as compensation of his professional service and disbursements, said sums to be paid to said Atty. by Pepin County and Pepin County shall be reimbursed by defendant as previously ordered.
Petition for Payment of County Appt'd Atty Fees

Defendant Jack Lee Christy in court with attorney S. Joseph Randtke.  Jon D. Seifert appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Sentenced to 10 days jail & stayed on 2 conditions:  1. continue to make county appointed attorney fee payment; 2. no other violations of harassment restraining order; court costs waived; provide DNA sample.  Advised of appeal rights.
Exhibits 1, 2, 3 O&R
We, the jury, find the defendant Jack Lee Christy, Guilty Violating a Harassment Restraining Order as charged.
Defendant Jack Lee Christy in court with attorney S. Joseph Randtke.  Jon D. Seifert appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Defendant Jack Lee Christy in court with attorney S. Joseph Randtke.  Jon D. Seifert appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Matter remains unresolved.  All parties to be present on May 11 by 8:30 a.m.
State's Witness List
M.M.B. is required to appear on 05/11/2015 at 9:00 am
S.R. is required to appear on 05/11/2015 at 9:00 am

Jury trial at 05-11-2015 09:00 am.
Final pre-trial at 04-20-2015 03:30 pm.

Jury Trial Scheduling Order:
1.  Trial of this matter is set for jury trial on May 11, 2015 at 9:00 a.m.  Time allowed for trial is 1 day.
2.  The District Attorney will send the Defense Atty their settlement offer prior to the FPT.
3.  The Defense Atty shall review the DA's settlement offer with his/her client prior to the FPT.
4.  A FPT is set for April 20, 2015 at 3:30 p.m..
5.  The Defense Atty, the Defendant, and the District Atty shall all personally appear at the FPT.
Failure of the Defendant to appear personally at the FPT shall result in the cancellation of the trial date and a warrant being issued for the defendant's arrest.
6.  All motions shall be filed in writing and no later than April 20, 2015. ....
If a motion is filed, the filing attorney shall contact the Court and obtain a pretrial motion hearing date.
Notices of alibi and responses shall follow the time limits and other requirements of Sec. 971.23(8) Wis. Stats.
7.  If either side intends to offer expert testimony..., such party shall give written notice to the court and opposing counsel no later than April 20, 2015, of the name, address and qualifications of the expert, the opinions which will be solicited from such expert and the basis for those opinions.
If any party intends to call a rebuttal expert in relation to such expert or testimony that party shall provide the same information as above w/in 15 days of receipt of the notice.  If either side opposes or seeks limitations on such expert testimony, that party shall promptly file a motion to be heard on a date before (but not at) the FPT.
8.  The State and the Defense shall file and serve no later than 5 days before the FPT:
a.  A list ... witnesses.
b.  Any nonstandard substantive or other JI they anticipate they will request be given by the Court.
9 - 10 (See Order in File)
Failure to comply with SCO may subject the attorney and parties to sanctions allowed in 805.03 Wis. Stats., including but not limited to .......
Attorney S. Joseph Randtke appears by phone.  Jon D. Seifert appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Atty Randtke requests matter be set for trial.

Defendant Jack Lee Christy in court with attorney S. Joseph Randtke.  Jon D. Seifert appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Defense counsel received an offer from the State, his client needs time to consider it.  Adjourned initial appearance scheduled for March 23, 2015 at 04:00 pm.

Ordered that Attorney Joseph Randtke is appointed to represent the defendant as defense counsel.
Further Ordered That the defendant shall reimburse the County by monthly installments of $75.00 per month commencing March 1, 2015, subsequent payments due the same day of each and every month thereafter.
Failure to make scheduled payments without a showing by the defendant of good cause shall be contempt of court punishable under Ch. 785, Wis. Stats. and the Court shall do any of the following:  See Order
Defendant Jack Lee Christy in court.  Jon D. Seifert appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Adjourned initial appearance scheduled for March 2, 2015 at 04:00 pm.  Notice provided to parties.

No contact with M.B.

Defendant Jack Lee Christy in court.  Jon D. Seifert appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Court inquires address S&C mailed to for defendant.  State informs the court it was mailed to 12974 Cty Rd F, Granstsburg.  Defendant informs the court that is his parents address, he in process of changing addresses.  He confirms he does not live at address on complaint of 318 W. Madison Street, Durand.  For now, address to use until defendant informs the court differently is the 12974 Cty Rd F address.  Judge advises defendant of charges/max. penalties and rights.  Court sets condition of release of no contact with M.B.
